channel.title: What happened to
channel.description: Showing when a user was warned, muted, or banned for a post? I felt like that really showed a level of authority by the staff, along with the general embarrassment for the user. That information shouldn't be kept private and underground, it should be used as a head on a stake to warn other users of where not to go.

item.title: What happened to
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:16, topic:398027”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=495163.msg3621907#msg3621907 date=1307495482]

I would just like to know who muted me, that’s my only problem with the current system.
[/quote]+1 I hate when I get an infraction and have to ask who gave me it.

I believe it was removed because the staff team were tired of members private messaging them and annoying them to remove it, or this and that about it being an false infraction, threats etc.

If the mod was compatible with SMF2 at the time, it prolly would have stayed. As the mod was not updated at the time MPSC/MITB forums did, so it never came back. As well as the fact, SMF2 has its own moderation system, it was never really needed anyways.[/quote]
That would be correct, and your talking about the visual modification was never really needed? Because I will have to agree on that, if not the warnings being showed when a staff member is warning X member, the warning, moderation, or banned group could be seen under the username still.
